intro: Calcearia mankiensis, commonly known as the Manki's sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy, yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Calcearia mankiensis typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its botanical structure supports its role in both ecological and ornamental horticulture.
